newsitem.title: YUGOSLAVIA: Yugoslavia has less tourists in Jan-July period.
newsitem.headline: Yugoslavia has less tourists in Jan-July period.

text.p: A total of 1.7 million tourists were registered in Yugoslavia from January to July, or eight percent less than in the same period 1995, the Yugoslav Statistic Office said in its latest report on Wednesday.
Yugoslav tourists accounted for 1.55 million, or 92 percent of this figure.
The number of foreign tourists in the first seven months rose by 58.4 percent to 86,300 against the same period in 1995, primarily from Russia, Italy, Britain, Bulgaria and Germany.
Visitors from other republics of the former Yugoslavia accounted for 81,700 of the total, increasing by 3.5 percent on the same period in 1995.
Despite the substantial increase in the number of foreign visitors this year, total overnight stays for the same period dropped two percent below last year's figure to 7.2 million.
